document.heading: Omnibus Personnel Reform Amendment Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-124, the “Omnibus Personnel Reform Amendment Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-44, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 3, 1998, and March 17, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 1, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-326 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-124 became effective on June 10, 1998.
